channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [AVRO-1899] PascalCase for property names generated by avrogen for C#
item.description:
Currently (code in branch 1.8) avrogen generates properties in C# data classes 1:1 as they are defined in shema, what results for field named 'favorite_color' in code like following:

public string favorite_color {
get

{ return this._favorite_color; }
set { this._favorite_color = value; }
}

In general property names should use PascalCasing (see: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms229043.aspx) and correctly generated code would look like

public string FavoriteColor {
get { return this._favorite_color; }

set

{ this._favorite_color = value; }

}

Potential change is rather minor:

.\avro\lang\csharp\src\apache\main\CodeGen\CodeGen.cs : 581
change
var mangledName = CodeGenUtil.Instance.Mangle(field.Name);

to
var mangledName = CodeGenUtil.Instance.Mangle(AsPropName(field.Name));

where AsPropName function may look like following

public string AsPropName(string name)

{ return Regex.Replace(name, @"^\S|_\S", match => match.Value.Replace("_","").ToUpper()); }
item.summary: PascalCase for property names generated by avrogen for C#

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [AVRO-1900] build.sh test fails for dev-tools.jar
item.description:
When i ran ./build.sh test in the docker container I was getting an error mentioning dev-tools.jar was not present.
When I looked further into it I realized that build.sh never actually builds dev-tools.jar.

I added a line in the test option to first mvn install on the dev-tools folder.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: ./build.sh test ran to completion.
I think we also need to change how ./build.sh dist works, but I haven't confirmed yet.
Sean Busbey I havent seen the need for it.

moving out of patch available.

I pulled this down and tried to build the 'dist' target prior to doing a 'test' run. It failed with an error in finding avro-tools.

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.17:check (checkstyle-check) on project avro-parent: Execution checkstyle-check of goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.17:check failed: Plugin org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.17 or one of its dependencies could not be resolved: Could not find artifact org.apache.avro:dev-tools:jar:1.9.0-SNAPSHOT in apache.snapshots (http://repository.apache.org/snapshots) -> [Help 1]

[ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
[ERROR]
[ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
[ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/PluginResolutionException

My guess is that if one first does a ./build.sh test run, we end up with a cached build of the avro-tools jar in the local repository. AFAICT the docker image mounts a system .m2 folder, so that caching will persist across runs.

Suraj Acharya, could you add proactively building the avro-tools artifact for the dist part of build.sh as well?

Added the explicit install call on dist.
Also, used a maven command to install dev-tools as opposed to a cd followed by mvn install.

I think the right way to fix this is to get rid of dev-tools. I flagged this on AVRO-1838, but didn't know that it would mess up the build script or wouldn't have committed it at the time. That issue was primarily about improving our checkstyle config anyway. Moving this back into lang/java/ will fix the problem so we don't need to document it for new Java devs while fixing the build.

GitHub user rdblue opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/avro/pull/122

AVRO-1900: Remove dev-tools to fix Java build.

The dev-tools module has to be built before working in lang/java. This
breaks the build.sh script and is a confusing failure for new Java
contributors. This commit fixes the problem by moving the checkstyle
config back into the lang/java/pom.xml. It is applied to all Java
modules under lang/java.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/rdblue/avro AVRO-1900-fix-java-build

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/avro/pull/122.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #122

commit 52e005ed22c5d07cb7f9da404449bf95853b34fe
Author: Ryan Blue <blue@apache.org>
Date: 2016-09-10T23:41:58Z

AVRO-1900: Remove dev-tools to fix Java build.

The dev-tools module has to be built before working in lang/java. This
breaks the build.sh script and is a confusing failure for new Java
contributors. This commit fixes the problem by moving the checkstyle
config back into the lang/java/pom.xml. It is applied to all Java
modules under lang/java.
I posted a fix that moves checkstyle into the lang/java build: https://github.com/apache/avro/pull/122

+1 on the patch to just remove dev-tools entirely.

Thanks for working on the first approach Suraj Acharya!

Commit 33d495840c896b693b7f37b5ec786ac1acacd3b4 in avro's branch refs/heads/master from Ryan Blue
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=avro.git;h=33d4958 ]

AVRO-1900: Remove dev-tools to fix Java build.

The dev-tools module has to be built before working in lang/java. This
breaks the build.sh script and is a confusing failure for new Java
contributors. This commit fixes the problem by moving the checkstyle
config back into the lang/java/pom.xml. It is applied to all Java
modules under lang/java.

Github user rdblue closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/avro/pull/122
Merged. Thanks for reviewing, Sean!

item.title: [AVRO-1901] creating a record called "Exception" leads to generated code not compiling
item.description:
consider the following *.avsc file:

Exception.avsc
{
  "type": "record",
  "name": "Exception",
  "namespace": "com.acme",
  "fields" : [
    {"name": "value", "type": "int"}
  ],
  "doc": "Will not submit to your fascist naming conventions"
}

the generated java code will contain:

Exception.java
...
@override
public Exception build() {
   try {
      ...
      return record;
   } catch (Exception e) { //boom
      throw new org.apache.avro.AvroRuntimeException(e);
   }
}

which fails to compile because Exception refers to the generated class (which does not extend Throwable)
item.summary: creating a record called "Exception" leads to generated code not compiling

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:

https://github.com/apache/avro/pull/115

fix AVRO-1901 - record named "Exception" generated bad code

catch fully qualified java.lang.Exception in record template

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/radai-rosenblatt/avro bad-record-names

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

with (at least) the following in the commit message:

Date: 2016-08-23T03:18:18Z

AVRO-1901 - fix issue by catching java.lang.Exception (fully qualified)
radai rosenblatt, are you trying to define an error in your IDL? If yes, have you tried the keyword error as shown in this doc?
I found this while trying to update the avro version used in an existing codebase. unfortunately I cannot rename the offending record for backwards compatibility reasons.

Ben McCann - there appears to be no interest. the 1.7 branch doesnt even compile anymore (see my PR here - https://github.com/apache/avro/pull/139), which means i couldnt even open a proper PR to fix this on 1.7. also the PR for 1.8 has been open for ages (https://github.com/apache/avro/pull/140)

commit adea35074ae0a0e920bab4dd1f5b4ea723d93222
Author: Ben McCann <bmccann@linkedin.com>
Date: 2017-01-13T23:22:57Z

AVRO-1901: Record named Exception generated bad code

Github user radai-rosenblatt closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/avro/pull/140

I left some feedback on the branch-1.7 backport, but generally it looks great.

radai rosenblatt and Ben McCann I don't think branch-1.7 has been EOLed or anything, the main blocker on a 1.7.8 release with this fix is 1) review bandwidth to ensure compatible fixes have made it back to branch-1.7 and 2) someone to corral a release candidate. 1.7.7 was 2.5 years ago, so if y'all were interested in taking up some of that burden, I'm sure there'd be plenty of folks who'd like an updated release; probably best to send a heads-up to the dev@avro mailing list to ensure you get some help pushing the needed commits.
